intro: Cacalia asarifolia, commonly known as the lesser bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Cacalia asarifolia is often found in woodland edges and meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
